verses.text: Shall a caviller strive with Almighty? He that argues with God – let him answer.
Then Job answered Jehovah and said:
Ah, how small am I! What can I answer? I lay my hand on my mouth.
Once indeed have I spoken; – enough: Yea twice – but not ever again.
Wilt thou disallow my right. And condemn me that thou mayest be justified?
Hast thou an arm like God? With a voice like His canst thou thunder?
Now deck thee with pride and with majesty, Clothe thee with glory and splendour.
Pour forth the floods of thine anger, And all that is lofty abase.
Every proud one lay low whom thou seest, And crush thou the wicked beneath thee.
Hide them together in dust, And bind their faces in darkness.
And I then will render thee praise That thy right hand hath won thee the victory. Two Wonderful Creatures of God The Hippopotamus
Behold now the huge beast beside thee: He eateth up grass like an ox.
Behold now the strength in his loins, And the force in the muscles of his belly.
He holds his tail stiff as a cedar, His thighs are of sinews entwined.
His bones are as tubes of brass, His limbs are like bars of iron.
He is chief of the ways of God, Made to lord it over his fellows.
The mountains yields him their fruits; All the wild beasts he grindeth to powder.
There under the lotus he lies, In the covert of reed and fen,
Protected by shade of the lotus, Encircled by water-willows.
From the wild rushing torrent he flees not; He is calm in the swell of a Jordan.
Who would venture to make for his eyes, Or to pierce through his nose with a cord? The Crocodile
